summary: Evangelos Biskas was born in Thessaloniki, Greece in 1994. He studied dance and choreography at Fontys Hogeschool voor de Kunsten (FHK) in Tilburg, Netherlands. As a performer, he worked with Fernando Belfiore, Katja Heitmann, Helder Seabra, Vloeistof, Close Act Theatre Company, United Cowboys and is currently working with Guilherme Miotto, Charlotte Goeasaert and Jack Gallagher. As a maker, some of his works such as The Jazz Dog, Noteleks and Don Quixote and The Bunny were performed in several artistic events, a few of them are the Museum Night at Van Gogh’s museum in Amsterdam, Boulevard Festival in Hertogenbosch, Festivalito Mon Amour in Lyon and Opening Oktober Dansmaand in Tilburg. He won the “Young Dance Makers 2016” award with his graduation piece “Eternal Chilling”, which will give him the chance to tour with a new work for the next season in collaboration with Dansmakers and the Moving Futures partners. The piece will also be played at Theatre de Vanves at the Festival Ardanthe in Paris Moreover, he was nominated for the “Jacques de Leeuw Prijs”, he has a residency at Dansateliers in Rotterdam called “One Night’s Dance” and was selected for a residency for young makers at De Nwe Vorst in Tilburg supported by Dansbrabant, L’Aventura and De Nwe Vorst.

awards.title: Nominated for Jack de Leeuw prize
Winner of Moving Forward- Young Dance makers 2016 Award

projects.title: Several Projects- As a performer and creator

23rd: Performing “Shango Trio” by Guilherme Miotto, Moving Futures Dance Festival, Rotterdamse Schouwburg, Rotterdam

24th: Research Presentation “In search of a title” in collaboration with Elysia Mc Mullen, De Nwe Vorst (white studio), Tilburg

16th: Research Presentation “In search of a title” in collaboration with Elysia Mc Mullen, De Nwe Vorst (white studio), Tilburg

25th: Performing “Eternal Chilling” in collaboration with Helena Araujo, Festival Ardanthe- La Decadance edition for young artists, Theatre de Vanves, Paris

30th: Research Presentation “In search of a title” in collaboration with Elysia Mc Mullen, De Nwe Vorst (white studio), Tilburg

April

8th: Performing “Shango Trio” by Guilherme Miotto, Moving Futures Dance Festival, Grand Theatre, Groningen

13th: Research Presentation “In search of a title” in collaboration with Elysia Mc Mullen, De Nwe Vorst (white studio), Tilburg

19th: Premiere “In search of a title” in collaboration with Elysia Mc Mullen, De Nwe Vorst,Tilburg

22nd: Creation for club event “Fremdkorper” initiated by Marc van Loon, Smederij, Tilburg

profile_positions.description:
Evangelos’s work is based on his inner need to express states of the mind and the body. He is fascinated by the contrasts created between human instinct, intuition and perception. In search of a deeper understanding of the function and the existence of the human being, he uses the human body as a medium that gives shape and form to life’s abstraction. His ultimate goal is to show richness and multiplicity in layers of meanings and symbols in order to invite the viewer into a trip, to stimulate one’s fantasy and to open up new doors for interpretations and associations. To inspire them to experience things from a different perspective so that they can re-evaluate on basic principles of human nature such as what we consider to be normal.

When working with his artistic team, he establishes an intimate working environment during a creation that creates fertile ground for artistic exchange. He challenges both himself and the performers in a making process by taking risks, surpassing comfort zones and constantly experimenting. At the same time he gives a lot of freedom to their creativity, potentiality and personality. Conceptually, he is interested in combining different theories from a vast field of sources including philosophy, dream analysis and modern physics which he aims to translate into concrete live images. Inspired by the movement of Surrealism, he deals with the theatrical elements in an aesthetic way as if they are a surreal painting of juxtaposed realities, striving for images of strong emotional power and poetry. He is searching for consequence in the choices of those characteristics; costumes, material, puppets, masks, décor, sound and light. Dance and performance is placed in relation to them, making his work potentially a total work of art. He is eager to adjust it in many different contexts in the working field such as theatres, musea, galleries and location festivals.
profile_positions.title: Performer, Choreographer
